title: Data Analytics - Introduction to Machine Learning - Revised
headline: Machine learning is the study of computer algorithms. This free course breaks down its use in modern data analytics.
description: Machine learning is an essential part of data analytics. This course will teach you about automation as well as supervised and unsupervised learning. You will also study important methods to help find hidden information within your data. Machine learning is invaluable for the development of computer systems that are able to learn and adapt without following explicit instructions.
courseOutcomes: Define the difference between supervised learning, unsupervised learning, and reinforced learning
Describe when regularization can be used
Distinguish between supervised and unsupervised data
Explain how to use Excel to perform a multiple regression
Distinguish between R² and adjustment R²
Define the difference between supervised learning, unsupervised learning, and reinforced learning
Describe when regularization can be used
Distinguish between supervised and unsupervised data
Explain how to use Excel to perform a multiple regression
Distinguish between R² and adjustment R²
courseDescription:
This course combines both machine learning and data analytics. The two go hand in hand to help make data sets easier to gather and interpret. Topics included in this course are reinforced learning, correlation and linear regression. Reinforced learning is the training of machine learning models to make a sequence of decisions and linear regression is used when you want to predict the value of a variable based on the value of another variable. 

You will be taken through a step-by-step programme to show you the most important formulae involved in multiple regression in Excel. This video-based learning means that you can go over and back to different lessons to remind yourself of little bits of information you may have forgotten. Following on from this, you will be introduced to the concept of regularisation, subset selections and how to distinguish between R&sup2 and adjustment R&sup2.

Data science and data analytics are diverse fields that have departments in many companies across the world. It is a field that is ever-expanding and evolving so if you want to have an indispensable skill that will get you hired in any company with a data analytics department, this course is for you.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this certificate course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this certificate course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison certificate is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital certificate: a downloadable certificate in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked certificate, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked certificate in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.
Start Course Now

All certificate are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison certificate, please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison certificate, you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. modules.description: In this module you will be introduced to machine learning. You will learn about supervised and unsupervised learning and the difference between them. You will also learn about regularization and liner regression.
topics: Introduction to Machine Learning Learning Outcomes
Introduction to Machine Learning Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you will learn about different types of regression. You will learn what confidence level is and how to use both Excel and Matlab for simple and multiple regression. You will also learn about the K-NN approach in data analytics.
topics: Simple and Multiple Regression in Excel and Matlab
Data Modelling Approaches and Algorithmic Modelling Approaches
